fields.summary: Add additional fields/entries to versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44463].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to categorize web links, the way issue links are categorized by issue-link types in the issue view. This would be useful in use-cases that require lots of web links to JIRA issues.

In extension, if Web Link categories are available, jql function facilites (provided especially by 3rd party plugins) could also make it possible to search for issues with links falling under specific categories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature for organizing web links to categories
fields.summary: Web Link Categories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44460].
  {panel}

*Suggestion:*
User would like the ability to use text formatting on a block of text ( multiple row of text ) .
Currently text formatting only works with a single row of text. 

For example when there is a block of text , after selecting the whole block and selecting Bold, the text will not be bold. Please refer to the screenshot below :

1. Enter a few rows of text. Please hit enter after each row to go to the next row. 
!screen1.png|thumbnail!
2. When previewing the text, it is not actually bold
!screen2.png|thumbnail!


*Workaround :*
Install & use the 3rd party plugin called [JEditor - Rich Text Editor for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.jiraeditor.jeditor] 
!jeditor.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to apply text formatting (eg: italic, bold style) to a block of text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44459].
  {panel}

The following exceptions was thrown when JIRA is trying to close unused SQL connections during re-indexing task. However, it's safe to be ignored as these exceptions are mainly for tracking purposes and the re-indexing task will be completed. 

(i) Please note that this only applies to any JIRA versions that contain the following files in the library. JIRA 6.4.8 supplies the following files as default.
• _entityengine-1.0.67.jar_
• _entityengine-share-1.0.67.jar_

{code}
2015-07-17 16:18:50,320 IssueIndexer:thread-8 ERROR user 123x456x1 192.168.10.123 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor] !!! ABANDONED SQLProcessor DETECTED !!!
	This probably means that somebody forgot to close an EntityListIterator.
	Connection: DelegatingConnectionImpl[connectionPoolInfo=ConnectionPoolInfo{maxSize=40, minSize=20, initialSize=null, maxIdle=20, maxWait=30000, sleepTime=300000, lifeTime=600000, deadLockMaxWait=600000, deadLockRetryWait=10000, validationQuery='select 1', minEvictableTimeMillis=60000, timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis=300000, poolPreparedStatements=null, testOnBorrow=null, testOnReturn=null, testWhileIdle=true, maxOpenPreparedStatements=null, numTestsPerEvictionRun=null, removeAbandonedTimeout=300, validationQueryTimeout=3, defaultCatalog=null},sqlConnectionInterceptor=org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.interceptors.connection.SafeDelegatingSqlConnectionInterceptor@1d7f909]
	SQL: select min( act.CREATED) from jiraaction act , jiraissue it where act.issueid = ?  and act.issueid = it.ID and act.actiontype = 'comment'  and it.REPORTER != act.AUTHOR
2015-07-17 16:18:50,320 IssueIndexer:thread-6 ERROR user 123x456x1 192.168.10.123 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor] !!! ABANDONED SQLProcessor DETECTED !!!
	This probably means that somebody forgot to close an EntityListIterator.
...
2015-07-17 16:18:50,322 IssueIndexer:thread-8 ERROR user 123x456x1 192.168.10.123 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [jdbc.interceptors.connection.SafeDelegatingSqlConnectionInterceptor] Unexpected exception from SQL connection interceptor callback: onConnectionReplaced([DelegatingConnectionImpl[connectionPoolInfo=ConnectionPoolInfo{maxSize=40, minSize=20, initialSize=null, maxIdle=20, maxWait=30000, sleepTime=300000, lifeTime=600000, deadLockMaxWait=600000, deadLockRetryWait=10000, validationQuery='select 1', minEvictableTimeMillis=60000, timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis=300000, poolPreparedStatements=null, testOnBorrow=null, testOnReturn=null, testWhileIdle=true, maxOpenPreparedStatements=null, numTestsPerEvictionRun=null, removeAbandonedTimeout=300, validationQueryTimeout=3, defaultCatalog=null},sqlConnectionInterceptor=org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.interceptors.connection.SafeDelegatingSqlConnectionInterceptor@1d7f909], ConnectionPoolStateImpl[timeToBorrowNanos=0,borrowCount=-26,connectionPoolInfo=ConnectionPoolInfo{maxSize=40, minSize=20, initialSize=null, maxIdle=20, maxWait=30000, sleepTime=300000, lifeTime=600000, deadLockMaxWait=600000, deadLockRetryWait=10000, validationQuery='select 1', minEvictableTimeMillis=60000, timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis=300000, poolPreparedStatements=null, testOnBorrow=null, testOnReturn=null, testWhileIdle=true, maxOpenPreparedStatements=null, numTestsPerEvictionRun=null, removeAbandonedTimeout=300, validationQueryTimeout=3, defaultCatalog=null}]])
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The OpTimer has been re-used.  end() can only be called once!
	at com.atlassian.instrumentation.operations.SimpleOpTimer.end(SimpleOpTimer.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.instrumentation.operations.SimpleOpTimer.end(SimpleOpTimer.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.instrumentation.operations.SimpleOpTimer.end(SimpleOpTimer.java:117)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.InstrumentedSQLInterceptor.onConnectionReplaced(InstrumentedSQLInterceptor.java:39)

fields.summary: Suppress the Exceptions Thrown During Re-Indexing Task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44451].
  {panel}

h4. Description
Issue operation dialogues, like "Create Issue", can not be moved or repositioned in the browser. 

h4. Suggestion
Allow dialogue boxes to be repositioned, so that a user can see the issue view screen that sits in the background.
fields.summary: Allow Issue dialogue boxes to be repositioned on the browser screen
Set a vacation period in JIRA to not receive notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44446].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Version Picker (multiple versions) field gives nullpointerexception on Issue Navigator as well as on "Edit Default Screen" if context has IssueType as well as Project 

h3. Environment
* Reproduced with JIRA 6.4.7


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add some versions for the project
# Configure a custom field of type Version Picker (multiple versions)
# Now, configure the context of the field to use some specific Projects as well as Issue types *instead of Global context*(see screenshot)
# Run a re-index of JIRA
# Create some issues with this field
# Search for these issues on Issue Navigator or try to edit the default value of the custom field.

h3. Expected Results
The issues show up properly. 
The default value can be edited without any problem.


h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2015-07-14 13:04:12,587 ajp-8009-13 DEBUG aaaaa 784x74040x1 kan0la 192.168.100.36 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable [com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.NullPointerException - null'.
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.VersionCFType.getUnreleasedVersionFirst(VersionCFType.java:288)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.VersionCFType.getVelocityParameters(VersionCFType.java:273)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.CustomFieldUtils.buildParams(CustomFieldUtils.java:475)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.getViewHtmlByValue(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:345)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.access$100(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:46){noformat}

 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to switch to Global context and then re-index the instance.
fields.summary: Version Picker (multiple versions) field gives nullpointerexception if context has IssueType as well as Project

fields.description: bla bla
fields.summary: A test from Belgium

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44442].
  {panel}

h2. Feature Request:
----

Currently in order to trigger workflow transitions you have to connect a post function to a web hook. 
This can get a little tedious and in the long run isn't really scalable for instances with a large amount of workflows. Offer the ability to manage default workflow transitions in web hooks. It would fall under the front facing documentation umbrella that mentions: "JIRA supports webhooks for all standard issue-related events."

----

*Screenshot of the Web-hook admin page:*
!j.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow default workflow transitions to be selected from the admin page when creating web hooks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44441].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no option to select all screens, in a single checkbox, for a custom field. This could especially be a problem if the admin has a large number of screens and he has to select them one by one. The following screenshot better explains the problem:
!customfieldscreens.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a *select all* option at the top of the list, that will automatically select all screens for that particular custom field.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to select all screens, using single checkbox, for Custom Fields
Ability to receive a notification if any changes in the user management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44437].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
It's pretty tedious to make a field *Required*. One would have to create a custom field, add it to a screen and then navigate to *Field Configuration* to make it required. The user will then have to make sure that this Field Configuration is then applied to the correct Scheme and Issue Type of the scheme

h3. Suggestion
Make it easier by placing a checkbox beside every field when configuring the screen. Tick the checkbox if you want a field to be required.
fields.summary: Easier way to make a field required
An 'Issue commented' notification should always be sent for a new comment
Add default subtasks issue type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44431].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an application link is created, *all* projects in JIRA will be able to link to the remote application.

In some cases, only certain projects need the functionality to link to a remote application. It is not needed for *all* projects to be able to link remotely and it will only add confusion for some of the users.

h3. Suggestion
Ability to restrict AppLink features to only certain projects.
fields.summary: Restrict Application Link to certain projects
Zephyr not working on JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44425].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, there isn't any API for retrieving add-ons details

h3. Suggestion
Create an API for this so that users are able to retrieve information such as
* Name
* Version
* Type
* License expiry date
* etc
fields.summary: Provide REST API for retrieving all installed add-ons details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44421].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It's not easy to retrieve information from multiple projects about what are the released versions. One needs to manually browse several projects.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create a new report that can retrieve Released Versions from multiple projects and display in a report.
fields.summary: Cross Project Release Reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44418].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On JIRA instances that heavily use mail handlers, the {{notificationinstance}} table can grow a lot, which ends up causing performance issues - specially since it appears that JIRA does a full table scan frequently. On Oracle DBs, this can be costly and degrade server performance.

h3. Suggested Solution
We should delete older entries from the table, similarly to what we did with the {{NotificationInstanceKiller}} that we implement as an upgrade task after JIRA 5.2 (see [this page|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/5.2/reference/com/atlassian/jira/startup/NotificationInstanceKiller.html#deleteAfterDelay] for more details). Also, we could add an index in the database for this table, to improve performance when searching on it.
fields.summary: Periodically clean up the notificationinstance table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44416]. {panel} *Problem* A user may report an intermittent issue and it would be helpful to know which host they are using when they access through Data Center just in case the issue is server related. For example: {quote}I have two nodes in a Data Center cluster. Users connect to JIRA via an alias that points to a load balancer that will serve one of the two nodes. My question is, which node is a user connected to? If a user complains of performance issues or gets an error or anything, it might be helpful to know which of the two (soon to be six) nodes they are connected to. Two browser sessions connected to the alias (the load balancer) look identical. I just want to see the hostname on the footer, or somewhere, so I can debug issues.{quote} *Suggestion* Install as standard somewhere on the page (ideally the footer where it is hidden in plain sight) or able to indicate this node is belong to which hostname. *Workaround* # Take note on the node 1 and 2 hostname. If you couldn't find it, you may open the Load Balancer configuration and review the hostname URL: {code} # JIRA node 1 BalancerMember http://jira1.hostname.com:8080 route=node1 # JIRA node 2 Commented pending node installation # BalancerMember http://jira2.hostname.com:8081 route=node2 {code} # Go to the node 1 installation directory and navigate to this path: {code}jira-install/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/footer/footer.vm{code} # Open the footer.vm file. # Search for the {{$licenseMessageClass}} and add this parameter before the {{$licenseMessageClass}}. For example: {code}

Footer:

#if($licenseMessageClass)
  • #if($unlicensed) {code} (i) Replace '' value to the node 1 hostname. # Save the file and restart node 1. # Repeat step 2 until 4 for node 2. # Save the file and restart node 2.
fields.summary: As an admin user, it would be great JIRA data center able to show hostname in each nodes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44415].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Certain features available in the Workflow Designer graphic mode may not be available in text mode (some of which is intentional). An example is configuring global transitions. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29873. 

There are sometimes scenarios where transitions and statuses are more easily accessible in text mode, some users may find this mode more suitable when editing workflows, and should be aware of the configuration options that are not available in this mode.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since we have a whole documentation page dedicated to [Working in text mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Working+in+text+mode] this may be a good place to note these limitations.
fields.summary: Note limitations in working in text mode documentation
Ability to Set Issue Security Level Based on Select List Custom Field
Improvment on Log Work
Cannot Search JIRA Issues Using Emojis 🐔 As Search Criteria

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44394].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The text "Live Broadcast" appears in place of the progress bar for attached mp3 files played directly from JIRA while using Safari.

Observed result:
The text "Live Broadcast" appears in place of the progress bar in Safari v.8.0.7

Steps to Reproduce:
# Attach a mp3 file to an issue in JIRA.
# Go to that issue using Safari.
# Click on the mp3 file attached to the issue
# MP3 opens in a new tab

h3. Suggested Solution
MP3 should play in the media player with the playback progress bar.
h3. Actual Results
The player displays "Live Streaming" instead of the playback progress bar.
 
h3.Workaround
Embed the issue using the {noformat}!attachment.mp3!{noformat} or use another browser.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see the playback progress bar on attached mp3s in Safari

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44392].
  {panel}

h4. Current Behaviour
* No available operator to search how many times an issue was in a particular status. 

h4. Feature Request
* Provide the ability to search how many times an issue was in a particular status
fields.summary: JQL Operator to search how many times an issue was in a particular status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44391].
  {panel}

h4. Description
Wiki Renderer has a functionality that it auto-completes lists, inserting a new bullet on a new line when the "Enter" key is pressed.
This functionality is seen on several text editors, like Microsoft Word or TextMate for Mac.

h4. Suggestion
Give JIRA users the option to turn this functionality off, since not always this is something desirable.
fields.summary: Option to disable auto-complete functionality for Wiki Renderer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44390].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Our support team includes a CC on all emails to a catchall account that JIRA reads from using its email handler to try to associate to tickets. A lot of these emails cannot be associated with a ticket which JIRA complains about, but it will not remove those emails and will continue to read them every time it checks the account when using POP3 or IMAP. This causes an extremely high load on our database server for some reason, which immediately drops when we remove these old emails.

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be an option for JIRA's email handler to delete messages it cannot associate

h3. Workaround 
Exchange Server/Outlook may see [Delete or mark email automatically at set date|https://www.msoutlook.info/question/automatically-delete-message-at-set-date]
fields.summary: Add option to delete mail that cannot be associated to a ticket
Versions: Make filter more obvious
Disable users ability to change avatars/profile picture

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44386].
  {panel}

Currently, when a user is assigned to a notification scheme, he or she would receive all notification they have been associated with.

The only way not to get notified is to ask the JIRA Administrator to remove them from the notification scheme or if they were watchers, stop watching the issue itself.

The reason for wanting to opt-out is due to how chatty JIRA notification can get at times and being able to selectively opt-out of notifications by having JIRA add a link to emails sent to them which they can click on should they want to opt-out of notification for just that particular issue.

This way users do not get notified too frequently and they can control in more details what notifications they want to receive and for which issues they'll like to receive notification from.
fields.summary: Allow Users to Opt out of Notifications in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44385].
  {panel}

Currently, when a user is assigned to a notification scheme, he or she would receive all notification they have been associated with.

The only way not to get notified is to ask the JIRA Administrator to remove them from the notification scheme or if they were watchers, stop watching the issue itself.

The reason for wanting to opt-out is due to how chatty JIRA notification can get at times and being able to selectively opt-out of notifications by having JIRA add a link to emails sent to them which they can click on should they want to opt-out of notification for just that particular issue.

This way users do not get notified too frequently and they can control in more details what notifications they want to receive and for which issues they'll like to receive notification from.
fields.summary: Allow Users to Opt out of Notifications in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

We work a LOT out of JIRA and this feature would be a great relief for our customers as well. 
Short feedback would be great if this could be done or is a won't fix.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44381].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As a JIRA User, it would be nice to be able to configure the Project 'Home' page.

Different users have different requirements for why they visit JIRA and may not agree with the default home pages shown. Being able to define a Project Level home screen would be a more ergonomic experience for the user.

h3. Expected Results
A configuration option to set a default home screen for all users and a method to override the setting on a per-project, per user basis.

h3. Actual Results
This feature does not yet exist.
fields.summary: Project Level Home page configurable for each user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44380].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the Remote Issue Copy plugin to copy an issue between two application linked JIRA instances, if there is a custom field type which the Remote Issue Copy can't map, and there is a custom field in the destination JIRA which is required in the Field Configuration for the project the issue is being moved to, then a NullPointerException is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Link two JIRAs via application links
# Install Remote Issue Copy plugin on both sides
# Ensure that there is some custom field provided by a third-party addon which is required on the field configuration of the project you want to copy the issue into
# Use remote copy to copy an issue into the project with the required third-party addon custom field

h3. Expected Results

An error message is displayed noting that the custom field type is not supported by the Remote Issue Copy plugin, and there is a required field in the destination of that type.

h3. Actual Results

An error displays in the browser, one of:

* Error occured when remote JIRA instance was processing request
* Remote copy couldn't communicate with remote JIRA instance.

The second error is actually a generic error meaning that the remote side didn't respond before the UI timed out.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
2015-07-20 15:38:33,865 http-bio-10634-exec-8 ERROR <username> 937x217x1 znrwnc 172.22.200.130 /rest/copyissue/1.0/copyissue/fieldPermissions [atlassian.cpji.rest.CopyIssueResource] Failed to check field permissions for source issue 'ISSUE-1
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.cpji.fields.permission.CustomFieldMappingChecker.getFieldPermission(CustomFieldMappingChecker.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.cpji.components.CopyIssueService.checkFieldPermissions(CopyIssueService.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.cpji.rest.CopyIssueResource.checkFieldPermissions(CopyIssueResource.java:59)
...etc...
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

# Make it so that affected custom fields are marked optional on the field configuration of the destination JIRA/Project.
fields.summary: Remote Issue Copy throws NullPointerException if an unmapped custom field is required at the destination

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44377].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In development, it is very common for a company to use Affect Versions and Fix Versions for Bug tickets where *Affected Versions* would be _the version of the product affected by the Bug_ and *Fix Version* would be _the version of the product where the Bug would be fixed_. Therefore it's not possible for a Bug to be in *both* Affected Version and Fix Version. 

h3. Suggestion
Have a default feature where upon resolving a ticket, the Fix Version must *not* contain the same version in the Affected Version. This can be in a general configuration, project configuration or maybe just in the validator, but should be in by default so users do not have to rely on add-ons or custom scripts to implement this since it is a very common usage.

Even better if this can also ensure that the Fix Version is a *later version* when compared to Affected Version. It is not possible for a Fix Version to be _version 1_ while Affected Version is _version 2_
fields.summary: Fix Versions not identical to Affected Versions upon resolving an issue

h3. Summary
At the moment, there is no way to start a *draft* review directly from JIRA. Draft reviews are commonly created especially when using Smart Commits. Due to JRA-44269 not being implemented yet, draft reviews created by smart commits will not be shown in JIRA at all making draft review not as useful as previously since the review won't be shown in JIRA

h3. Suggestion
Have a way to start a draft review, either by clicking a link or maybe through a post function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44350].

h3. Problem Definition
The issue collector allows for a number of fields to be added to a modal window, when adding a number of fields in a custom issue collector the description field is too large, and forces scroll bars onto the window. 

As a result users may miss seeing the fields at the bottom of the window.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the fields to be resized to fit the form, whether though the UI or through the custom issue collector customization.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to resize the description in the JIRA issue collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44344].
  {panel}

As an administrator you can analyse project role usage before deleting one. 

At the moment only notification, permission and issue security level schemes are analysed together with active workflows that may contain Project Role condition. This isn't enough. You can restrict visibility of comments and worklogs to a Project Role, also inactive workflows may have references to a role that is about to be deleted. 

Right now JIRA gives inaccurate picture of a project role usage.

Also, the summary page displayed before one deletes a role with associations is incomplete and doesn't show the whole picture which may result in administrator taking action on a false premise.
fields.summary: View Usage for Project Role doesn't analyze comments, worklogs and inactive workflows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44338].
  {panel}

The issue collector only allows for users with the jira-user global permission to raise issues.
If the email address used in the form it not mapped to a user with this permission, the default reporter will be used instead.

If the issue collector is being used for a Service Desk project, requests raised by customers will always be set with the default reporter since customers (generally) do not have the jira-user global permission, even though their email address can be mapped to a user with the permission to raise issues in the Service Desk project.

This causes inconsistencies for the reporter of such issues, and prevents the issue being visible for the actual reporter.

Can functionality get implemented for the issue collector to recognise customers as valid reporters when using the issue collector on Service Desk projects?
fields.summary: JIRA Issue collector does not recognise customer user types as valid reporters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44332].
  {panel}

According to REST API documentation for Delete Group, you can pass a swapGroup query param (which is optional) which is "a group to transfer visibility restrictions of the group that is being deleted". 

One could expect that passing the param would result in replacing deleted group with swapped group in all schemes (permission, notification, issue security) but also comments and worklogs where you restricted visibility. Which is not true. The group is swapped only for comments and worklogs. Someone decided that "visibility restrictions" stands only for these two entities. However you do restrict visibility of an issue by setting its security level, don't you?

Probably we can't change behaviour of the resource (it's part of API) and underlying GroupService, but we can at least document it better, as is the GroupService#deleteGroup documented, so it's clear what will get swapped.

We'd also consider retiring GroupService#deleteGroup and DELETE /group?swapGroup behaviour in favour of swapping groups in comments and worklogs but also all schemes, which will make it consistent with RoleService and DELETE /role implementation, which (will) swap role in comments, worklogs, and schemes.
fields.summary: Ambiguous swapGroup parameter in Delete Group REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44277].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating too many issue security issues can create some serious performance issues within JIRA. Limit or at least warning the customer that they are about to run into this issue when creating more than the recommend number of Issue Security Levels within the product could prevent customers from making an implementation decision that causes negative performance impacts within their environment and a poor experience of JIRA.

h3. Environment
JIRA + Many Issue Security Levels.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Many Issue Security Levels as per: [Configuring Issue-level Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security]
# Exceed the recommended limit of ten Issue Security Levels.
# Observe degradation of JIRA performance as a result of this.

h3. Expected Results
We should _at least_ warn the customer that using too many issue security levels will potentially impact JIRA performance, and if possible implement both soft and hard limits on the number of issue security levels that can be created. There could also be the possibility of allowing these values to be set with flags so that the limitation can be knowingly breached. 

h3. Actual Results
The current implementation relies on customers reading the recent versions of the Documentation that highlight this performance issue. This doesn't work for a few reasons:
- Users that are 'old hat' or confident with the product functionality might not consult the documentation.
- User that have implemented one or two issue security levels, my erroneously think the feature can support many more levels without consulting the documentation
- Users that are finding the functionality might not consult the documentation.
fields.summary: Create Limits and Warnings on too many Issue Security Levels

Feel free to change the summary if this one isn't clear. This is the scenario:
Every now and then I do a 'spring-clean'. Remove obsolete workflows and other items.
To see the workflows I can delete I need to either collapse the Active panel or scroll down, then open the Inactive panel. After I click Delete the screen refreshes. To delete the next workflow I need to scroll down again and open the Inactive panel again.

It would be nice if Jira would remember the status of those panels, at least until I leave the page.
fields.summary: On the Workflows screen persist the panel status after an action

h3. Problem Definition
For JIRA with application links another application (eg. Fisheye, Stash, etc), it would be great if whenever there is a reference in a source code (eg. comments), there will be a link in the JIRA issue so the user can click on the link and be redirected to the source code. At the moment, it requires a commit to have a link. 

h3. Suggested Solution
This suggestion is for links to appear without having to commit anything.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44242].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The feature we would like to have is to have an option to set this JNDI property in Jira User Directory LDAP configuration:
Property: java.naming.ldap.derefAliases
Setting values:
Property Setting	Description
always	Always dereference aliases.
never	Never dereferences aliases.
finding	Dereferences aliases only during name resolution.
searching	Dereferences aliases only after name resolution.


For further information: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/jndi/tutorial/ldap/misc/aliases.html
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to set the dereferencing property for my LDAP configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44234].
  {panel}

Hello,
Today, even with the recent JIRA version it’s not easy and safe to operate a change of Labels in bulk mode: When your items are tagged with several various labels - which labels are made for-  it can be really risky to update them in bulk because you may overwrite some existing labels with your new one. In order to avoid that, you have no choice but doing the update operation by groups of items that have identical labels values.

Illustrating with a simple example:
Let say you have the 3 following JIRA items (of course real use cases involve more issues) tagged with these labels: 

* Item J-XX2:    Labels= [ADEPT][Cont.Delivery][Quikwin]
* Item J-XX13:  Labels=[ADEPT]
* Item J-XX27:  Labels= [ADEPT] [PP] [Quikwin]
* …

… and say you need to tag these [ADEPT] items with an additional label [Candidate].
Well, currently you just can’t use the bulk mode for that and update these 3 items in one operation. (As you would necessarily overwrite existing labels values). What you need to do then is to identify items with similar labels and bulk edit them, retyping the existing labels plus the one that you need to add... Quite painful not to say hazardous in practice.

So I'm thinking it would really empower the Labelling feature in JIRA, if we could simply append or remove a label value on a selection of issues (no matter the various labels actually set currently for each one of these)

Thanks for considering this suggestion.
Stephane
fields.summary: Support the Append / Remove mode in bulk edition for the "Labels" field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44229].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some Issue Types, such as Epic and Story, indicate that they should not be edited however there is nothing which prevents that from occurring.
!IssueTypes.png|thumbnail!

Use case:
Customer edited the Epic Issue Type to "New Type."  If viewing an Agile Scrum Backlog, "New Type" is not displayed as Epics are Hidden from the Backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a "locking" feature similar to non-editable System Fields to prevent these Issue Types from being edited
 
h3. Workaround 
Update the modified Epic Issue Type back to "Epic" and create a New Issue Type
fields.summary: Lock Issue Types From Being Edited

When attaching a file to a JIRA issue, the upload will fail with the message "Internal Server error occurred".

To reproduce:
# Create an image file with the name "/.png"
# Attempt to attach it to an issue

Expected: 
# File is attached with the name "/.png"

Actual: 
# File fails to attach. File name displays as ":.png".
fields.summary: Forward slash in Issue attachment file name causes Internal Server Error
